thread.title: Dele Alli apologised to his Tottenham team-mates but did not mean his horror tackle, says Toby Alderweireld
thread.title_full: Dele Alli apologised to his Tottenham team-mates but did not mean his horror tackle, says Toby Alderweireld

author: gstonehouse
title: Dele Alli apologised to his Tottenham team-mates but did not mean his horror tackle, says Toby Alderweireld
text:
'He said sorry' Dele Alli apologised to his Tottenham team-mates but did not mean his horror tackle, says Toby Alderweireld 
Spurs defender comes out in support of midfielder after his X-rated challenge in the Europa League BY DAN KING Comments TOBY ALDERWEIRELD has defended Dele Alli after his horrific foul and red card. 
Alli, 20, was sent off for a gruesome challenge on Gent’s Brecht Dejaegere in the 2-2 draw at Wembley which resulted in Spurs going out of the Europa League. BT SPORT Dele Alli’s tackle was high on Brecht Dejaegere’s shin and gave the ref no option but to show him red 
Alderweireld said: “Of course he said sorry. He didn’t mean to get sent off. 
Keep up to date with ALL the TOTTENHAM news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
“Two seconds before someone made a foul on him and he reacted on that but not to get a red card. 
He is young and I know for 100% he didn’t mean (to do it).” Related Stories In-san-ity Arsenal fans left distraught after being told Alexis Sanchez will leave the club during stadium tour A step too var Jamie Vardy among Leicester players who met with chairman a day before Claudio Ranieri was sacked you plonk-er Leicester owner bragged of axing boss Claudio Ranieri as he blew £500,000 on wine and champagne at exclusive cellar in London's West End sam rage at flops Sam Allardyce claims his struggles are down to his Crystal Palace players not following his orders TEAM NEWS Crystal Palace vs Middlesbrough team news: Eagles sweating on key defender while Boro without two men 
The exit from European football leaves Tottenham to focus on the FA Cup and on trying to close the gap on Chelsea in the Premier League , starting with a home game against Stoke on Sunday. 
Just don’t tell Alderweireld to find the positives in not having to submit to the Thursday-Sunday-Thursday grind of game after game. 
The Belgium international said: “If you are not qualifying then it is not a blessing in disguise. Of course not. We are disappointed. Reuters Dele Alli was shown the first red card of his professional career Reuters Toby Alderweireld has defended Alli and said that his team-mate apologised to the squad after the game PA:Press Association 4 This was the shocking moment Dele Alli launched himself at Gent defender Brecht Dejaegere, studs first 
“A club like Tottenham has to go through. But the attitude with 10men was unbelievable and the defence was solid. 
“ It was wonderful and we deserved to go through. 
“If you play this kind of level in Europe with ten v 11 men you have to have some positives and even if you are now disappointed, you need three points on Sunday. 
“We have still the FA Cup and the league to fight for so we will do everything to fight for them.” Dele Alli is on top form in this new adidas advert that just won't let you forget his name
